intro: Monarda purpurascens, commonly known as the scarlet beeplant, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant features showy, tubular red flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving them a slightly fuzzy texture. Monarda purpurascens thrives in full sun to partial shade and is often found in moist, well-drained soils.
